abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is judged as
            partially satisfactory. However, project sustainability is
            deemed uncertain in the absence of the implementation of
            reforms in the management and funding mechanism of the road
            sector. Overall, the World Bank's performance in
            preparing and supervising the project was satisfactory. The
            Borrower's performance was mixed (less than
            satisfactory and partially satisfactory in various issues)
            between effectiveness and 1996, then it improved to
            satisfactory thereafter. The environment under which the
            project was designed changed drastically due to various
            factors that impeded the project, the most significant being
            the civil strife that broke out in 1993 and thereon,
            hampered the implementation of the project. A follow-up
            project is planned for FY2001. The key lessons learned are
            to: 1) keep the objectives few and simple; and 2) be less
            ambitious in planning different reforms in a country in
            which political risks are high and that has had no past
            experience with the private management and implementation of
            civil works.

18151288.theme: Other financial and private sector development,Regulation and competition policy,Infrastructure services for private sector development,Other public sector governance
18151288.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Public sector governance

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will support at the sector
            level, the macroeconomic policy of the Government and its
            efforts of structural adjustment.  The objectives of the
            project are to : 1) reform transport sector policies; 2)
            develop planning capabilities within MTPDU and MTPT; 3)
            consolidate and improve maintenance practices and
            institutions, including support for starting up the
            participation of the private sector in road maintenance
            activities; 4) upgrading a selected road to paved standards;
            and 5) providing support to coffee production and marketing
            through rehabilitation and maintenance of access roads to
            the coffee production areas.  The project will have two
            major components as follows : 1) institutional support to
            the General Directorate for Transport ( DGT ); 2) Four year
            road rehabilitation and maintenance program which includes :
            a) periodic maintenance of paved roads; b) limited
            upgrading; c) rehabilitation of coffee roads; d) subsector
            related studies; e) institutional strengthening.
